page.title: 14CHURCHES
page.content: {ST PETER BESFORD}The only timbered framed church in the county, not later than{14th cent.}The tower and spire is the work of{19th cent.}restorers. monuments include those of{Sir Edward {Sebright 1679}of{Besford Court.} {ST JAMES DEFFORD}The main features of this church are the timber framed upper tower and the sculpture of a female head which forms the keystone of the south door. {ST MARY MAGDALENE}CROOME Rebuilt on a new site in{1763}probably by {Capability Brown}with interiors by {Robert Adam.}It is medieval on the outside but Georgian Gothic inside. It contains the monuments to the{Coventry family from{Croome Court}which it served. That for the Fourth Lord{1687 is by{ {Grinling Gibbons.
